title: Newsbreak : Goya Foods Nearis Sale to Carlyle in $3.5B Deal
text:
Newsbreak : Goya Foods Nearis Sale to Carlyle in $3.5B Deal - Report

Stock Markets 18 hours ago (Oct 18, 2019 18:50)

© Reuters. Investing.com - Goya Foods reportedly is in late-stage talks to sell a majority stake to The Carlyle Group (NASDAQ: ) in a deal that would value the canned-foods giant at about $3.5 billion, The New York Post reported. Goya's rice, beans, olives and cooking oils are ubiquitous on shelves across supermarkets throughout the U.S. The company is being valued at a healthy mid-teens multiple to its EBITDA, or earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization, the New York Post reported, citing a source briefed on the talks. In May the company hired Goldman Sachs (NYSE: ) to explore its options in what was expected to be a $3 billion sale.

Newsbreak : Goya Foods Nearis Sale to Carlyle in $3.5B Deal - Report
